data.title: Uncaught IndexSizeError: Failed to execute 'setEnd' on 'Range': The offset 501 is larger than or ...
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. open libsteam_api.so
2. scroll

**Atom Version**: 1.0.0
**System**: Linux Mint
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught IndexSizeError: Failed to execute 'setEnd' on 'Range': The offset 501 is larger than or equal to the node's length (500).

```
At /opt/atom/resources/app.asar/src/tile-component.js:444

Error: Failed to execute 'setEnd' on 'Range': The offset 501 is larger than or equal to the node's length (500).
```

data.title: Atom and Git
data.body:
Hello,

There is an issue with Atom when we work with git.
If I add lines in a file (php in my case) the git gui show that I added a lot of space in my file 

Screenshots:
Atom editor: http://puu.sh/iDuSA/554e6e4446.png
Git result: http://puu.sh/iDuVq/fbc4167856.png

Windows 8.1
Version 1.0.0.

data.title: Projects lost on closing ATOM
data.body:
Hi,
I loose all my projects on closing ATOM and reopening it. :( Is there a setting for this to retain them on close..
Thanks

data.title: Cannot search plugins
data.body:
Hi, 
After installing a plugin, I cannot search another plugin.  I need to restart ATOM to make this work.

![screen shot 2015-06-26 at 8 31 39 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5646166/8380330/c6b4c4b6-1c42-11e5-96bb-a2834ed9f024.png)

data.title: voiceover screen reader support MacOS X
data.body:
Atom has no VoiceOver screen reader support on MacOS X. This means it is unusable by the blind and print disabled. VO is part of OS X and should be supported. 

Tested on MacOS X 10.10

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'removeAllListeners' of undefined
data.body:
Reporting issue Atom threw at me...

**Stack Trace**

```
TypeError: Cannot read property 'removeAllListeners' of undefined
  at Task.module.exports.Task.handleEvents (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/task.js:85:31)
  at new Task (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/task.js:71:12)

  at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/git-repository.js:77:26
```

I've had two windows open of same project but one deeper in as a sub-project of the original. The main project view is a project in github.

data.title: The ellipsis character is now recognized as punctuation
data.body: It is no longer selected by double-clicking. #7047

data.title: Feature request: move the opened folders and files state record into config.cson
data.body:
See here: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7424#issuecomment-115650925

Can it be possible to move the opened folder and files state record into config.cson?
config.cson will be saved into a gist with the Synchronize Settings plugin.

When I used Atom zip, I usually deleted everything in the `C:\Users\[Username]\.atom` folder at version upgrade, except config files in the parent and packages folder, to maintain version compatibility. This way (think) I deleted the last opened files and folders state.

data.title: Atom package issue: Linter-clang
data.body:
Hi,

i've installed atom, and i try to intall a linter-clang package but the instalaltion fail, they told me to send you a file but i don't find it on the following path (/tmp/apm-install-dir-115526-8646-d09wkj/npm-debug.log)

data.title: Zooming moves position in document
data.body:
Just upgraded to atom 1.0 on Ubuntu 14.04, and realized that the zooming feature (`crtl +` either `+` or `-`, or using `ctrl` and the mouse wheel) changes font size, but also jumps to a different position in the document.

To me it looks like the position is maintained in form of pixels from the top of the document, but when for example zooming out (`crtl + -`), more text fits within those pixels, so that I end up way down in my document.

Would be cooler if instead of the pixel from top the current line was maintained.

data.title: plugins search can't work at 1.0 release
data.body:
Use case:
Open Packages -> Settings view -> Install packages, then enter some text in search field, but nothing doing.
for get result I must change Packages button to Themes and switch again for a get search result.
No 'Enter' key action here too

data.title: Long waiting times when opening minified js file.
data.body:
Hey there,

I am not sure this has been reported yet and it could very well be related to this #979 issue.

When I open a minified file (in my case a default jquery v1.11.2) I get the `Keep Waiting or Close` dialog.

I can reproduce that 100% every time. Now I opened the file in dev mode and recorded the timeline and get the below:

![screen shot 2015-06-26 at 9 48 48 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1266923/8376688/2cba85e8-1c4d-11e5-8f42-af33b9dee451.png)

Hope this helps

Atom: 1.0.0
OS: Mac 10.10.3

data.title: atom.workspace.openSync calls the undefined atom.project.openSync
data.body:

OS: Any

Calling atom.workspace.openSync calls the undefined atom.project.openSync method.

and do not emit error log-text.

I never have installed atom in my computer, and I prepare the /squirreltemp folder before execute "AtomSetup.exe", and emitting the message, "Failed to extract installer".  and do not emit log as with above.

data.title: The .python-version file causes build failure when using pyenv
data.body:
The `.python-version` file was added with pull request #4454. 

When building Atom (any version) on Arch Linux (using AUR package: https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/atom-editor/) with pyenv installed (https://github.com/yyuu/pyenv), this is what happens:

```
Node: v0.12.5
npm: v2.11.3
Installing build modules...
gyp ERR! configure error 
gyp ERR! stack Error: Command failed: python2 -c import platform; print(platform.python_version());
gyp ERR! stack pyenv: version `2.7.6' is not installed
gyp ERR! stack 
gyp ERR! stack     at ChildProcess.exithandler (child_process.js:751:12)
gyp ERR! stack     at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:110:17)
gyp ERR! stack     at maybeClose (child_process.js:1015:16)
gyp ERR! stack     at Socket.<anonymous> (child_process.js:1183:11)
gyp ERR! stack     at Socket.emit (events.js:107:17)
gyp ERR! stack     at Pipe.close (net.js:485:12)
gyp ERR! System Linux 4.0.5-1-ARCH
gyp ERR! command "node" "/usr/lib/node_modules/npm/node_modules/node-gyp/bin/node-gyp.js" "rebuild"
(...)
```

After digging deeper with PYENV_DEBUG=1, we can see that pyenv tries to use Python 2.7.6 as specified in `.python-version` present in Atom's source:

```
gyp ERR! stack + [pyenv:108] exec /home/ancestor/.pyenv/libexec/pyenv-exec python2 -c 'import platform; print(platform.python_version());'
gyp ERR! stack + [pyenv-exec:20] '[' python2 = --complete ']'
gyp ERR! stack ++ [pyenv-exec:24] pyenv-version-name
gyp ERR! stack + [pyenv-version-name:6] '[' -z '' ']'
gyp ERR! stack ++ [pyenv-version-name:7] pyenv-version-file
gyp ERR! stack + [pyenv-version-file:21] find_local_version_file /tmp/pacaurtmp-ancestor/atom-editor/src/atom-1.0.0/build/node_modules/runas
(...)
gyp ERR! stack + [pyenv-version-file:10] echo /tmp/pacaurtmp-ancestor/atom-editor/src/atom-1.0.0/.python-version
gyp ERR! stack + [pyenv-version-file:11] exit
gyp ERR! stack + [pyenv-version-name:7] PYENV_VERSION_FILE=/tmp/pacaurtmp-ancestor/atom-editor/src/atom-1.0.0/.python-version
gyp ERR! stack ++ [pyenv-version-name:8] pyenv-version-file-read /tmp/pacaurtmp-ancestor/atom-editor/src/atom-1.0.0/.python-version
gyp ERR! stack + [pyenv-version-file-read:6] VERSION_FILE=/tmp/pacaurtmp-ancestor/atom-editor/src/atom-1.0.0/.python-version
gyp ERR! stack + [pyenv-version-file-read:8] '[' -e /tmp/pacaurtmp-ancestor/atom-editor/src/atom-1.0.0/.python-version ']'
gyp ERR! stack + [pyenv-version-file-read:11] IFS='     
'yp ERR! stack 
gyp ERR! stack + [pyenv-version-file-read:12] words=($(cut -b 1-1024 "$VERSION_FILE" | sed 's/^\s*\(\S\+\).*/\1/'))
gyp ERR! stack ++ [pyenv-version-file-read:12] cut -b 1-1024 /tmp/pacaurtmp-ancestor/atom-editor/src/atom-1.0.0/.python-version
gyp ERR! stack ++ [pyenv-version-file-read:12] sed 's/^\s*\(\S\+\).*/\1/'
gyp ERR! stack + [pyenv-version-file-read:13] versions=("${words[@]}")
gyp ERR! stack + [pyenv-version-file-read:15] '[' -n 2.7.6 ']'
gyp ERR! stack + [pyenv-version-file-read:16] IFS=:
gyp ERR! stack + [pyenv-version-file-read:17] echo 2.7.6
gyp ERR! stack + [pyenv-version-file-read:18] exit
gyp ERR! stack + [pyenv-version-name:8] PYENV_VERSION=2.7.6
gyp ERR! stack + [pyenv-version-name:11] '[' -z 2.7.6 ']'
gyp ERR! stack + [pyenv-version-name:11] '[' 2.7.6 = system ']'
gyp ERR! stack + [pyenv-version-name:21] versions=()
```

It is Is there any reason for this file to actually be in the repository? Unless there is anything in Atom that requires Python version to be exactly 2.7.6 and pyenv for building it, the only effect this file would have is enforcing an old Python version on pyenv users.

There is a workaround, by overriding Python version with `pyenv shell`, but maybe the file could just be removed to avoid using this workaround for each build?

data.title: Editor is not responding (infinite loop)
data.body:
Installed Atom Editor yesterday and after installing a few packages, the program freezes and prints.

"Editor is not responding
The editor is not responding. Would you like to force close it or just keep waiting?"

http://i.imgur.com/2COp8Kr.png

This happens even after reinstalling and reopening the program dozen of times. "Keep Waiting" is also not working.

System: Windows 8.1 Pro
ps: Overall the editor was really buggy, even with default settings/without having any community packages installed.

data.title: entering \ not possible
data.body:
I installed the windows Version (Win7, 64bit), Atom 1.0 and i cant input \ (Alt-gr + ß) on a german keyboard.

Doesnt work in Latex or textfile.

data.title: pane resize handles overflow over editors
data.body:
If you have a vertical split, the resize handle overflows to the right, possibly over an adjacent editor. This messes with drag-select. I haven't found out how to solve this. 

The layout to reproduce this:

```
---------------------
|         |         |
+---------|         |
|         |         |
---------------------
```

cc @simurai 

![screen shot 2015-06-26 at 10 52 04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2543659/8373997/fff9d38e-1bf1-11e5-92d5-c23ddedaa700.png)

data.title: Windows uninstallation is too silent
data.body: When uninstalling Atom from the Windows control panel, after clicking "uninstall", absolutely nothing appears to happen. Then, several seconds later, the "Atom" entry suddenly disappears from the list of installed packages. This total lack of feedback is not very user-friendly, IMO.

data.title: Syntax parsing long lines in files causes Atom to lockup "not responding"
data.body:
Opening this file:  https://github.com/espadrine/aulx/blob/master/html/tokenizer.js

Causes the parser to choke and Atom warns several times about not responding. Eventually you have to give up and quit the whole app.

The exact line that is doing it is this: https://github.com/espadrine/aulx/blob/master/html/tokenizer.js#L63

If I remove the line there is no problem.

I notice that when opening the file in Sublime 3 they don't syntax colorize that line at all. For any really long line they just skip it.

Probably related issues: 
https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6830
https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5882

The issue was reported by this guy: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=9782812

data.title: in shell scripts, cat << EOF [...] EOF coloring is not honored
data.body:
Hi all,

The following code has bad syntax highlight because of unmatched hard quote `'` inside a `cat` block, even though it's fine: 

``` sh
#!/bin/sh
count=0

cat << EOT
c'est un texte
EOT

echo "$(basename "$0")"
if [ "$count" -lt 5 ]; then
    echo "$count"
fi
printf '%s\n' "Finished!"
exit 0
```

(should look like)

``` sh
#!/bin/sh
count=0

cat << EOT
ceci est un texte
EOT

echo "$(basename "$0")"
if [ "$count" -lt 5 ]; then
    echo "$count"
fi
printf '%s\n' "Finished!"
exit 0
```

(Seems to be an issue on GitHub too :wink: )

data.title: Available Updates still shows Atom 1.0 deprecation warning in Atom 1.0
data.body:
When viewing "Available Updates" in Atom 1.0, the deprecation warning is still visible.

![monosnap 2015-06-26 09-47-07](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1171825/8372937/575db654-1be8-11e5-9aaa-4f92f8a56194.png)

I believe this message should not exist in Atom 1.0, or should at least be rephrased, as "when Atom 1.0 is released in June" is an event that has now already come to pass.

Atom Version: 1.0
OS X: 10.10.2

data.title: "System.OutOfMemoryException" when installing on windows
data.body:
latest atom setup on windows 7 enterprise sp1.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5162663/8371800/9332c6d0-1c0e-11e5-83c4-cdd493407106.png)

there's "System.OutOfMemoryException" exception in log from SquirrelTemp. But task manager shows over 3G memory available.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5162663/8371841/519ec3d0-1c0f-11e5-9a44-edf441897930.png)

```
Program: Starting Squirrel Updater: --install .
Program: Starting install, writing to C:\Users\x\AppData\Local\SquirrelTemp
CheckForUpdateImpl: Failed to load local releases, starting from scratch: System.IO.DirectoryNotFoundException: Could not find a part of the path 'C:\Users\x\AppData\Local\atom\packages\RELEASES'.
   at System.IO.__Error.WinIOError(Int32 errorCode, String maybeFullPath)
   at System.IO.FileStream.Init(String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, Int32 rights, Boolean useRights, FileShare share, Int32 bufferSize, FileOptions options, SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES secAttrs, String msgPath, Boolean bFromProxy, Boolean useLongPath, Boolean checkHost)
   at System.IO.FileStream..ctor(String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, FileShare share)
   at Squirrel.Utility.LoadLocalReleases(String localReleaseFile)
   at Squirrel.UpdateManager.CheckForUpdateImpl.<CheckForUpdate>d__28.MoveNext()
CheckForUpdateImpl: Reading RELEASES file from C:\Users\x\AppData\Local\SquirrelTemp
CheckForUpdateImpl: First run or local directory is corrupt, starting from scratch
ApplyReleasesImpl: Writing files to app directory: C:\Users\x\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.0.0
IEnableLogger: Failed to install package to app dir: System.OutOfMemoryException: Exception of type 'System.OutOfMemoryException' was thrown.
   at System.IO.MemoryStream.ToArray()
   at NuGet.StreamExtensions.ToStreamFactory(Stream stream)
   at NuGet.ZipPackageFile..ctor(PackagePart part)
   at NuGet.ZipPackage.<GetFilesNoCache>b__12(PackagePart part)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereSelectEnumerableIterator`2.MoveNext()
   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1..ctor(IEnumerable`1 collection)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToList[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source)
   at NuGet.ZipPackage.GetFilesNoCache()
   at NuGet.ZipPackage.GetFilesBase()
   at NuGet.LocalPackage.GetFiles()
   at NuGet.PackageExtensions.GetFiles(IPackage package, String directory)
   at Squirrel.UpdateManager.ApplyReleasesImpl.<installPackageToAppDir>d__8e.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at Squirrel.Utility.<LogIfThrows>d__54`1.MoveNext()
```

data.title: Request to add "frame" and "transparent" as config settings
data.body:
Just wondering if the `frame` and `transparent` options can be added to the config setting that Atom loads on startup?  I'm thinking under the `editor` namespace.

Maybe something like:

```
'core':
  'excludeVcsIgnoredPaths': true
'editor':
  'frame': false
  'transparent': true
```

data.title: Atom 1.0 will consume 100% CPU when managing packages
data.body: No matter installing or uninstalling packages, `Atom Helper` will comsume over 100% CPU.

data.title: Atom 1.0 doesn't install on Ubuntu 14.10
data.body:
Below is what happened:

```
sudo dpkg --install atom-amd64.deb
(Reading database ... 531640 files and directories currently installed.)
Preparing to unpack atom-amd64.deb ...
Unpacking atom (1.0.0) ...
dpkg-deb (subprocess): cannot copy archive member from 'atom-amd64.deb' to decompressor pipe: unexpected end of file or stream
dpkg-deb: error: subprocess paste returned error exit status 2
dpkg: error processing archive atom-amd64.deb (--install):
 cannot copy extracted data for './usr/share/atom/chromedriver/chromedriver' to '/usr/share/atom/chromedriver/chromedriver.dpkg-new': unexpected end of file or stream
Errors were encountered while processing:
 atom-amd64.deb
```

My system is:

```
lsb_release -a
No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID: Ubuntu
Description:    Ubuntu 14.10
Release:    14.10
Codename:   utopic
```

data.title: path balloon is not refreshed after "Save As..." operation
